plugin.description: This plugin allows more powerful search operators, searches to be saved and refreshed with a single click, and to replace text across multiple notes.

plugin.lastUpdateInfo:
3.0.0: Significant changes to align with welcome new native search capabilities in NotePlan  v3.18.1.
In particular, when you are running v3.18.1 it will assume you're using the new native search syntax.
Please see the README to learn more!

plugin.settings.title: Use native search?
plugin.settings.description:
If true, the plugin will use the native search capabilities in NotePlan, including many new 'search operators'.
This requires you running NotePlan v3.18.1 or later. If not set, or if you're running an older version of NotePlan, the plugin will use the old search capabilities (from Plugin v2).

plugin.settings.title: Case Sensitive searching?
plugin.settings.description: By default searches in NotePlan ignore the case (capitalisation) of characters. This plugin will use case sensitive searching if this is turned on.

plugin.settings.title: Match only on full words?
plugin.settings.description:
By default search terms in NotePlan matches on parts of longer words. Turn this on to restrict searches to matching full words only.
Note: When using the new native search syntax, you can turn this on for a particular search by putting the search term(s) in double quotes.

plugin.settings.title: Folders to exclude
plugin.settings.description:
Optional list of folders to exclude in these commands. If a folder is listed, then sub-folders are also excluded.
To exclude the top-level folder, use '/'. (The special Trash folder is always excluded.)

plugin.settings.title: Automatically save
plugin.settings.description:
If true, will save to an automatically-named note in the configured folder, starting with the search terms. 
This always applies for /quickSearch, but can be turned off for other commands.

plugin.settings.title: Folder name
plugin.settings.description: Folder to store output files in.

plugin.settings.title: /quickSearch note title
plugin.settings.description: Note title for /quickSearch results.

plugin.settings.title: Display style for search result lines
plugin.settings.description:
Choose the style to use:
- Normal 'NotePlan' styling, showing tasks, bullets and quotes, tweaked slightly for matching headings. You need to use this if you want to use the power of sync'd lines with the /searchOpenTasks command.
- Use 'Simplified' text, more like web search engine results.
Note: this affects some of the following settings.

plugin.settings.title: Result set size limit
plugin.settings.description: Result set size limit: if the search produces more than this, it will only return the first ones up to this limit.

plugin.settings.title: Heading level
plugin.settings.description: Heading level (1-5) to use when writing section headings in output.

plugin.settings.title: Saved Search heading
plugin.settings.description: Text to append to headings in search results (optional).

plugin.settings.title: Sort order for results
plugin.settings.description: This controls the order that the results are displayed in.

plugin.settings.title: Group results by Note?
plugin.settings.description: This controls how results are displayed. If true, matches found within the same note are grouped together. If false, every match is shown with a note link at the end of the match.

plugin.settings.title: Prefix for search result lines
plugin.settings.description: String to put at the start of each search result line (where display style is 'Simplified'). Default is '- '. Can also be empty.

plugin.settings.title: Result quote length
plugin.settings.description: Length of matching line to quote in the search results. To always quote the full line set this to 0. Note: this only applies in the 'Simplified' display style.

plugin.settings.title: Highlight matching search terms?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to ==highlight== the matches in the result lines. (Works best when using a theme with highlighting.)

plugin.settings.title: Date style
plugin.settings.description:
Where the match is in a calendar note, choose where that link is shown as
- a 'date' using your locale
- an NP date 'link' (e.g. [[2022-06-30]])
- an 'at' date (e.g. @2022-06-30), or
- a 'scheduled' date (e.g. >2022-06-30).

plugin.settings.title: Default Search terms
plugin.settings.description: Optional list of search terms to use to pre-populate the search term box.

plugin.settings.title: Log Level
plugin.settings.description: Set how much output will be displayed for this plugin in the NotePlan > Help > Plugin Console. DEBUG is the most verbose; NONE is the least (silent).

plugin.settings.title: Enable Timer logging?
plugin.settings.description: For plugin authors to help optimise the plugin.

plugin.settings.title: Run Comparison?
plugin.settings.description: If true, it will run a comparison between the old and new search capabilities, and log the results.
